question: Question_06_(b)
sols:
Taking the derivative of the cdf found in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH103/April_2013/Question_06_(a)}{part
a} we have

\begin{align*}
p(x) &= F'(x) = \left(\frac2{\pi}\left(\arctan\left(\frac{x}2\right) + \frac{\pi}4\right)\right)' \\
&= \frac2{\pi} \cdot \left(\frac{1}{1 + \left(\tfrac{x}{2}\right)^2}\cdot\frac{1}{2} + 0\right) \\
&= \frac1{\pi} \cdot \frac{4}{4 + x^2} = \frac4{\pi(4 + x^2)}\end{align*}

completing the question.
hints:
What is the relationship between the cdf in terms of x and the pdf in
terms of x.

The pdf in terms of \emph{x} is just the derivative of the cdf in terms
of \emph{x}.
